text: is a Japanese volcano near the city of Shimabara in Nagasaki Prefecture on the island of Kyūshū. Unzen is an active volcano.United States Geological Survey (USGS), "Deadliest Volcanic Eruptions Since 1500 A.D." ; Geological Survey of Japan, "Active Volcanoes in Japan"; retrieved 2012-6-15. ==History== Unzen has erupted many times.Johnston, Eric, "Latest volcano show: Shinmoe," Japan Times. 1 March 2011; retrieved 2012-6-15. ===Timeline=== * May 21, 1792 (Kansei 4, 1st day of the 4th month): Earthquake centered at Unzen caused tsunami which hit Higo ProvinceNational Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Geophysical Data Center, Significant Earthquake; retrieved 2012-6-15. * June 3, 1991 (Heisei 3): The volcano erupted violently, killing 43 scientists and journalists.Connor, Steve. "The men and women in woolly hats who risk their lives to study volcanoes," The Independent (UK). 22 April 2010; retrieved 2012-6-15. == Related pages == * List of volcanos * Dormant volcano * Extinct volcano ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Volcanoes of Japan
title: Mount Unzen
